attributes.action: Stop uk holiday sites ripping us of for going away during school holidays.
attributes.additional_details: Stop these company’s taking us for a ride, we all work hard and deserve a holiday but whilst the sites get richer we sometimes have to go without. Is it any wonder parents take there kids out of school to go on holidays,
attributes.background: A fixed price or a cap on holiday company’s in the uk charging us 4-5 times more during children’s school holidays, a holiday in Cornwall cost £2045 a week on last week of august, a week later when kids are back at school the exact holiday was £395. This isn’t fair.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about the prices for holiday's during the school holidays are a matter for private companies, not the Government or House of Commons. 

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
